title: Putin and Xi Celebrate Ties Unbroken by Russia’s War in Ukraine
description: President Vladimir V. Putin welcomed Xi Jinping, China’s top leader, to Russia, briefly noting Beijing’s peace plan for Ukraine but stressing Moscow and Beijing’s enduring partnership.

title: Macron’s Government Survives but Faces Wrath of France Over Pension Overhaul
description: Two no-confidence votes failed to oust the cabinet of President Emmanuel Macron over his raising the retirement age to 64 from 62.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Xi Meets Putin in Moscow
description: Also, a major U.N. climate report and a manhunt in the Indian state of Punjab.

title: Lead Exposure From U.S. Car Batteries Threatens Health of Mexican Workers
description: The removal of lead from car batteries, many from the United States, at recycling plants in northern Mexico has led to high levels of lead contamination, a new report found.

title: Xi Condemns Killings in African Nation Where Russian and Chinese Interests Compete
description: Nine Chinese nationals were killed in the Central African Republic, where the Kremlin-aligned Wagner group controls a gold mine and Chinese companies have built their own operations.

title: French government and Macron’s retirement overhaul survive a no-confidence vote. Here’s the latest.
Biden Administration Authorizes $350 Million for Ukraine Military Aid
description: The latest infusion of aid is aimed at giving Ukraine much needed ammunition ahead of a planned spring offensive.

title: Blinken Says Xi’s Russia Visit Amounts to ‘Diplomatic Cover’ for War Crimes
description: The U.S. secretary of state said the Chinese leader’s visit indicated that Beijing felt “no responsibility” to hold Russia accountable for atrocities in Ukraine.

title: Who’s Behind the Judicial Overhaul Now Dividing Israel? Two Americans.
description: Kohelet, the once-obscure think tank that conceived and now champions a revamped court system, is an American import.

title: European Officials Agree to Supply More Artillery Shells to Ukraine
description: Ukraine is using up artillery shells faster than the West can produce them.

title: Meta Manager Was Hacked With Spyware and Wiretapped in Greece
description: Artemis Seaford, a dual U.S.-Greek national, was targeted with a cyberespionage tool while also under a wiretap by the Greek spy agency in a case that shows the spread of illicit snooping in Europe.

title: France Live Updates: No-Confidence Vote Nears as Fury Grows Over Pensions
description: Lawmakers in France are debating motions to oust President Emmanuel Macron’s cabinet, days after he rammed a proposal to raise the legal retirement age through Parliament without a full vote.

title: First Official Estimate of Somalia’s Drought Shows 43,000 Dead
description: At least half of the deaths were children under the age of 5, according to the report by health researchers, the United Nations and the Somali government.

title: American Held Hostage in Africa Is Freed
description: Jeffery Woodke, an American aid worker abducted in Niger by militants, was released after more than six years in captivity.

title: What to Expect From France’s No-Confidence Vote
description: Lawmakers in the National Assembly will debate two motions to oust President Emmanuel Macron’s cabinet and defeat his plan to raise the national retirement age.

title: Israel’s Leaders Advance Key Part of Judicial Overhaul but Delay Rest
description: The government vowed to press on with a plan to take more control over appointing judges. But other changes were postponed in a move that was presented as a concession.

title: Macron Cabinet Faces No-Confidence Vote in France’s Pension Bill Fight
description: President Emmanuel Macron rammed a proposal to raise the legal age of retirement through France’s Parliament without a vote, touching off violent protests and angering lawmakers.

title: 1948: Egypt Starts Power Project
description: Laying the foundation stone of a hydroelectric project that would have ambitious successors.

title: Australian State Moves to Ban Nazi Salute After Rally
description: After neo-Nazis appeared at a protest against transgender rights in Melbourne, a local politician was facing expulsion from her party for taking part in the demonstration.

title: Who Are Russia’s Friends Amid the War in Ukraine?
description: India and South Africa are among the nations that have not criticized Russia for invading Ukraine. Some others have supplied military aid.

title: Earth to Hit Critical Warming Threshold by Early 2030s, Climate Panel Says
description: A new U.N. report says it is still possible to hold global warming to relatively safe levels, but doing so will require global cooperation, billions of dollars and big changes.

title: India Blocks Internet in Punjab as Security Forces Pursue Separatist
description: The rise of Amritpal Singh, a self-styled preacher, has raised fears of violence in Punjab, where thousands died in the 1980s during a Sikh insurgency.

title: Live Updates: Xi Arrives in Moscow for State Visit to Highlight China’s Ties to Russia
description: China is calling Xi Jinping’s visit a “trip for peace,” but he is unlikely to risk straining the country’s ties with Russia and President Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Indictment Week?
description: If Trump is indicted, this week will be unlike any other in American politics.

title: A WWII Pilot Saved His Crew. It Took 80 Years to Identify His Remains.
description: Lt. William B. Montgomery flew a B-24 Liberator toward the British coast after it was hit in June 1944. Historians credit him for saving the lives of seven crew members.

title: Macron Cabinet Faces No-Confidence Vote in France’s Pension Bill Fight
description: President Emmanuel Macron rammed a proposal to raise the legal age of retirement through France’s Parliament without a vote, touching off violent protests and angering lawmakers.

title: Lead Exposure From U.S. Car Batteries Threatens Health of Mexican Workers
description: The removal of lead from car batteries, many from the United States, at recycling plants in northern Mexico has led to high levels of lead contamination, a new report found.

title: Why China and Russia Are Closer Than Ever
description: This week’s meeting between the leaders of China and Russia marks another key moment in the deepening relationship between the two powers.

title: Some Details on the Agenda for Xi Jinping’s Visit to Russia
description: The Chinese leader is expected to talk to Vladimir V. Putin about Ukraine and other issues.

title: The Children of the Iraq War Have Grown Up, but Some Wounds Don’t Heal
description: Twenty years after the U.S. invaded Iraq, a veteran Times correspondent and photographer asked Iraqis about growing up in wartime, and about their hopes now.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Will Trump be arrested this week?

title: Xi Heads to Russia, Praising Putin and Saying Little About Ukraine
description: China is calling Xi Jinping’s visit a “trip for peace,” but he is unlikely to risk straining the country’s ties with Russia and President Vladimir V. Putin.
